original_title: Sri Lanka to re-jig agriculture, give 300,000 acres for commercial farming: President
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will give 300,000 acres of land for commercial farming as part of efforts to transform the country’s agriculture sector into a competitive sector which is competitive, President Ranil Wickremesinghe said.
About 100,000 acres from state plantations will be released, he told the Sri Lanka Economic Summit 2023 organized by the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce.
“I will restrict it to local entrepreneurs,” President Wickremesinghe said.
In Mahaweli System A and B, 75,000 to 100,000 acres of land will be released.
Sri Lanka’s regional plantations companies also had about 400,000 acres of land.
Sri Lanka was also doing the two largest privatization ever by giving ownership to 50,000 flat dwellers and freehold title to farmers who had two million acres of land, President Wickremsinghe said.
Sri Lanka will also give freedom to farmers with paddy land in the Wet Zone areas to cultivate whatever they wanted to plant in their land.
“We will pass legislation for you to cultivate anything you want in the Wet zone paddy fields,” he said.
In Kurunegala and Kandy land could be used for export agriculture.
Sri Lanka also wanted to promote dairy, and make it export competitive, he said.
